title: Daily Construction Site Safety Checklist
description: A daily checklist to ensure safety compliance, hazard control, and site readiness on a construction site.

sections.title: General Site Conditions
items: Site perimeter fencing secure and intact
Clear signage (safety, hazards, PPE requirements)
Emergency exits and evacuation routes clearly marked
Site clean and free of debris or obstructions
Adequate lighting for work being performed
No evidence of unauthorized entry or vandalism

sections.title: Worker PPE Compliance
items: Hard hats being worn by all workers
High-visibility clothing worn and clean
CSA-approved safety boots in good condition
Eye and hearing protection used where required
Respirators or masks used properly (if applicable)
Arc flash or specialized PPE available and worn (if needed)

sections.title: Fall Protection
items: Guardrails installed where required
Fall arrest systems available and inspected
Workers using proper anchor points
Harnesses and lanyards in good condition
Ladders and scaffolds stable, inspected, and properly used

sections.title: Tools & Equipment
items: Tools in good condition and stored properly
Power tools grounded or double insulated
Equipment operators certified and authorized
Equipment inspections done and logged
Machinery guarding in place
Extension cords not frayed or pinched
Lockout/tagout procedures followed (if applicable)

sections.title: Electrical Safety
items: Temporary panels locked and labeled
GFCIs used on all temporary power circuits
No exposed wiring or tripping hazards
Cord management in place (e.g., raised, covered)
Clearances maintained from overhead lines

sections.title: Housekeeping & Waste Management
items: Walkways and stairways clear
Materials stacked/stored safely
Waste disposed of in bins or designated areas
Dust control in place (e.g., sweeping, water spray)
No slip, trip, or fall hazards present

sections.title: First Aid & Emergency Preparedness
items: First aid kit stocked and accessible
Emergency contact list posted
Fire extinguishers inspected and accessible
Spill kits available and complete
Communication device (phone/radio) charged and ready

sections.title: Environmental Conditions
items: Weather conditions monitored and recorded
Heat/cold stress mitigation in place (hydration, breaks, warm-up)
Wind considerations for overhead/lift work
Adequate shelter or shade for breaks

sections.title: Worker Orientation & Communication
items: All workers signed in and oriented
Toolbox talk completed and documented
JHAs reviewed for all tasks
Safety concerns reported and addressed

sections.title: Subcontractor Compliance
items: Subcontractors following site safety rules
Proof of insurance and safety certifications available
Subcontractors signed in/out properly
Dedicated safety reps available (if required)
